meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the Earth's upper atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The aeronomic research team launched a weather balloon to collect data.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use aeronomic instruments to measure atmospheric conditions.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomic experts were so high up in the sky, they almost touched the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her mind soared with aeronomic thoughts, reaching heights of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomic phenomena painted the sky with colors unseen before.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the composition and behavior of the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The aeronomic changes in the atmosphere affected weather patterns.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists study aeronomic data to predict storms.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomic dance of the clouds entertained the children below.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as unpredictable as the aeronomic conditions outside.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomic composition of gases created a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the scientific study of the upper atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The aeronomic observations helped understand ozone depletion.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on aeronomic models to simulate atmospheric processes.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomic expedition faced unexpected challenges but persevered.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with aeronomic mysteries waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomic study revealed secrets hidden in the sky above.
